I think Meica got what it takes to be independent. Sure, she's got Mai, Gachikoi, and Mixer friend, but that doesn't mean she can't handle things on her own. I mean, have you seen her streams? She's got a great personality and knows how to engage with her fans. Plus, she's got some mad skills when it comes to gaming and singing.
I understand that some people might be worried about her leaving WACTOR, but I think that's just a sign that she's ready to take on new challenges. She's been with the company for a while now, and it's time for her to spread her wings and fly.
And let's not forget about her loyal fanbase. They've been with her through thick and thin, and I have no doubt that they'll continue to support her no matter what. In fact, I think they'll be even more excited to see what she can do on her own.
So yeah, I'm rooting for Meica. I think she's got what it takes to be successful, and I can't wait to see what she'll do next.

Yeah, I agree with you bro. It's not surprising that other companies are interested in Hina. She's a talented and entertaining Vtuber, and I think a lot of people would love to work with her.
And let's be real, drama happens in the Vtuber industry all the time. It's not uncommon for Vtubers to switch companies or go independent after drama or disagreements with their current company. Hina wouldn't be the first or the last to do so.
But I do think it's important for companies to handle drama and conflict in a professional and respectful manner. It's not fair for Vtubers to be mistreated or taken advantage of, and I hope that companies are taking steps to ensure that their talents are being treated with respect and fairness.
At the end of the day, I just want to see Hina succeed and be happy. Whether she stays independent or joins another company, I'll continue to support her and enjoy her content.

It shows that she's not afraid to take risks and stand up for herself, which can be admirable qualities in the eyes of potential business partners or collaborators. Plus, if she's successful as an independent Vtuber, that could attract even more fans and opportunities for her in the future.
So I understand the importance of a good corporate reputation, but I think Meica's potential as an independent Vtuber should also be taken into consideration. It's not a black-and-white issue, and there could be benefits and drawbacks to both staying with a company or going independent.

I agree that maturity is important in the entertainment industry, but it's not always necessary to act in a strict professional manner to be successful. Meica's charm and unique personality are what draw people to her, and those qualities aren't necessarily linked to strict professionalism. Additionally, it's possible that she simply has a different approach to her work and values a more relaxed and authentic approach to her content. That doesn't mean she's not taking it seriously or that she won't mature over time. Let's give her the space and time to develop her own style and grow in her own way.

Plus, let's not forget that being a "corporate puppet" isn't the only way to succeed in the industry. Many successful VTubers have gone independent and carved out their own path. >>46035635
I understand that you have concerns about Meica's ability to retain viewers and interest, but it's important to consider the bigger picture. While it's true that she may have lost some viewers at the end of her time with WACTOR, that doesn't necessarily mean she can't be successful on her own. Many factors can contribute to fluctuations in viewer numbers, including changes in content, lack of promotion, and competition from other VTubers.
Furthermore, it's possible that Meica's departure from WACTOR and subsequent independent career may actually attract a new audience and reinvigorate interest in her. She now has the freedom to create content on her own terms and develop her brand without the limitations and restrictions of a corporate agency. It's important to give her a fair chance and see how she grows and evolves in her new journey.

I agree that Meica has made mistakes in the past. However, I also think that everyone deserves a chance to learn from their mistakes and grow as a person.
At first, I was angry when I found out about Meica's lie about moving from the countryside to the city. It felt like a betrayal of trust, and it made me question everything she had said in the past. However, as time went on, I started to realize that everyone makes mistakes, and it's important to give people a chance to make things right.
Meica has since apologized for her actions and has tried to make amends with her fans. She's also been more transparent about her personal life and has tried to be more open with her fans. I think it's important to recognize that it takes a lot of courage to admit when you're wrong and try to make things right.
As for the accusation of "cucking" her fans, I think it's important to remember that Meica is a person with her own feelings and desires. While I don't condone cheating or dishonesty, I also don't think it's fair to judge someone without knowing all the details of their situation. It's possible that there were extenuating circumstances that we're not aware of, and it's not our place to judge.
In summary, I think it's important to recognize that Meica is not perfect, but she's also not irredeemable. We should give her a chance to learn from her mistakes and grow as a person, and support her in her efforts to do so. Let's try to focus on the positive aspects of her content and give her constructive feedback when needed.
